results.title: Oral hygiene: Johnnie and the D.K. robot
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Larkin Studios
results.brief_description: The importance of brushing teeth before going to bed, told in a dream which involves a little boy, a trip into space, and a D.K. Robot. On the planet Yum-Yum where sweets grow on trees, the children lose their teeth until Johnnie introduces them to toothbrushes and toothpaste. Animation and live footage.
results.title_for_label: Oral hygiene: Johnnie and the D.K. robot

results.title: Optical Toy, Anamorphosis, French Emperor Napoleon III,  Walter Frères 1865
results.brief_description: Constellation: The anamorphic drawing presents a distorted perspective of Napoleon III that is corrected when reflected on a circular surface. Napoleon III declared himself emperor of France in 1851, bringing the Second Republic to an end. William Kentridge’s anamorphic animation refers to Italy’s invasion of Ethiopia under Mussolini when 275,00 Ethiopians lost their lives. The title highlights the recurring nature of history.
results.title_for_label: Optical Toy, Anamorphosis, French Emperor Napoleon III, Walter Frères 1865
results.description: Anamorphic illusion hide their true subjects in distorted perspectives. When viewed with a viewing cylinder they reveal recognisable images, with some even made to unveil their images when viewed from the right vantage point. Anamorphic drawings helped establish perspective in paintings, photography and special effects, and they also influenced the development of Cinemascope and widescreen in film.
description_for_label: Anamorphic illusion hide their true subjects in distorted perspectives. When viewed with a viewing cylinder they reveal recognisable images, with some even made to unveil their images when viewed from the right vantage point. Anamorphic drawings helped establish perspective in paintings, photography and special effects, and they also influenced the development of Cinemascope and widescreen in film.

results.title: Optical jig borers at work
results.creator_credit: Montana Film Zurich and Societe Genevoise D'Instruments de Physique
results.brief_description: A documentary on precision milling and boring machines. Opens by telling us the story of how a group of people created the “Societe Genevoise D’Instruments de Physique”, a society formed to create a way to measure using unit measurements. We then travel into the future to see how the dividing machines they originally created are working now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Montana Film Zurich and Societe Genevoise D’Instruments de Physique

results.title: Operative training
results.creator_credit: Cygnet Films and PA Management Consultants
results.brief_description: An illustration of the application of advanced training methods to increase productivity in industry and commerce. Various tests are made on suitability of a candidate whose skill and stamina are then built up to the required standard of an experienced operative.

results.title: Operation X-70
results.brief_description: A satire on “scientific” warfare in which the new X-70 gas is accidentally dropped on a friendly nation, creating a surprising mutation. Won Special Jury Prize, Cannes International Film Festival 1972. Etchings by Marc Ampe, Animation by Willy Verschelde. Includes voice-over by Leonard Cohen amongst others.

results.title: Operation Venus
results.creator_credit: Alvin Yudkoff and Paramount Educational Services Division
results.brief_description: This film documents one of the first telephone “hot-lines” for teenagers by teenagers concerning venereal disease. The message is “Trust us. Call us. We will help you with understanding, in confidence”. Emphasises the importance of being responsible, the value of being educated and the rewards of honesty.

results.title: Operation sprats
results.brief_description: Looks at the sprat fishing industry in England. Fishing and canning operations are described with emphasis on the introduction of mechanisation. Trawlers, working in pairs, use echo-sounding equipment to locate shoals but netting and pulling-in still require all hands on deck. Machines cope with cleaning, grading, smoking and tin-can production and sealing at the canning factory but dexterous hand labour is needed to fill the tin with correct quantities of fish.

results.title: Operation post haste
results.creator_credit: John Fitzsimons, J.W. Hutchinson and Department of Postmaster-General
results.brief_description: Presents the Post Office’s new services to the public, including air mailing letters where it would speed delivery. Modern mail-handling machinery expedites the delivery of 200 million letters each year. By using the recommended standard size envelope and folding enclosures correctly, so that letters do not have to be handled manually, the public can help the Post Office to provide a speedy service.

results.title: Operation picul stick
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatises the scope for improved methods in a typical small factory, showing how production can be improved by better safety measures and simple handling of equipment. New equipment is installed, methods improved and results achieved.
